Job Description As the Telco Solution Architect, you will be responsible for the overall end to end architecture of the customer solution and implementation of CXOS SaaS platform, MNO and other third parties integration. The expectations of the role are as per below: Roles & Responsibilities : Lead business and technology solution architecture and design for Telecom Business Support System (BSS) i.e. CRM, Billing, Order Management and Enterprise Product Catalogue. Work harmoniously with different stream leads in the technical team to orchestrate the outcomes from a technical standpoint. Providing the overall architecture guidelines and sets the vision for our Telco solution. Ensure timely delivery of planned technical outcomes, and within budget while maintaining and possibly exceeding the desired quality. Ownership to provide necessary solutions to all the Functional and Non-Functional requirements. Own and define architecture roadmap, technology elements work packages for each domain/application and application roadmap. SPOC for all communication with customer IT and Service Design teams and manage work-stack level stakeholder relationships with customer. Steering direction from technical perspective, conducting and facilitating technical reviews. Conducting workshops to close the requirements, technical decisions etc. Preferred Qualifications & Experience Requirements: 10+ years of experience in E2E BSS areas with specific focus on Real Time Charging & Billing, CRM, Provisioning, Order Management and fulfillment, Enterprise product catalogue, telco system integration. IT and/or software development experience in one or more of the following areas: large-scale, mission-critical applications, Product Catalog, Billing, CRM, Fulfilment, OSS, general large-scale system architecture, large-scale databases. Extensive experience in consulting, solution leadership and solution delivery with in-depth technical experience in BSS solutions and overall IT Architecture of a telecom operator. Must also have prior experience driving consulting engagements around technology, operational and business consulting. Must have prior experience driving big OSS/BSS Transformation programs, especially onto BSS Transformation Program. Proven implementation experience with at least two large BSS solution rollouts in Telco industry. In depth understanding of fixed, mobile and convergence domains and related markets. Ability to work closely with Sales, Business Development, Pre-Sales and Clients in building E2E Convergent BSS Solutions Demonstrated knowledge of major industry standards: eTOM, SID, TAM, ITIL, OSS/j. Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills, as well as strong strategic and analytical skills. Well-developed knowledge and understanding of the global telecommunications marketplace.

• Reporting to Group Senior Tax Manager, you will be responsible for all tax matters for Singapore • Manage all statutory reporting, queries from authorities, independently liaise with external agents • Identify cost savings, utilize incentives to mitigate tax exposure for the region Support tax planning activities for onboarding of new markets Stay up to date of changes in tax regime and accounting standards, effective application Qualifications: • Degree qualified in Finance and/or Accounting with at least 5 years of working experience • Technically strong, stays abreast of accounting standards and tax incentives • Analytical and proactive to propose methods to reduce tax exposure • Strong communication skills to engage independently with regional stakeholders and external consultants • Highly motivated team player that works collaboratively with finance teams

Work closely with Group Tax team and other members of the tax and finance departments to execute the comprehensive tax advisory, compliance and litigation functions with a primary focus in indirect taxes, and ensure compliant tax reporting procedures with the local legislation in every country. Identify and research various tax issues and clearly articulate your findings to management through verbal / written communication (i.e. memorandums, PowerPoint, etc.) and verbal presentations. Expected to uphold a strong working partnership with internal departments and external tax advisors and tax authorities. Lead all indirect tax initiatives for the Group. Have the ability to operate independently, make decisions and thrive on execution. Be part of a cross-functional team that works on rolling out new products and services in the region. Review legal contracts from an overall tax perspective to provide comprehensive analysis and recommendations. Assist with the management of challenging tax matters, including leading litigation matters, corresponding with tax authorities and the provision of tax audit support. Work in a smart, innovative way to drive improvements to processes, controls and reporting across the region and across operations. Requirements: Finance, accounting and/or law degree. 5+ years of strong indirect tax experience of the APAC region in industry, law firms, and/or Big 4, knowledge and good understanding of corporate tax would be a plus. Technology based/e-commerce sector experience strongly preferred. Solid understanding of international indirect tax concepts, particularly as it relates to cross border services, marketplace/merchant relationships, and product roll-outs. Solid experience in the management of indirect tax processes and controls with a comprehensive understanding of the overall tax environment in each country. SOX compliance experience preferred. Strong written and verbal communication skills, excellent research skills required. Self motivated, detail oriented, strong organization, analytical, and strong interpersonal skills, a team player. Ability to work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing, and high-growth organization, and to develop and sustain relationships internally and cross-functionally. Open to challenging projects outside areas of experience or comfort zone. Ownership, drive and energy.

Job_Title: Raffles Hotel Singapore - Talent and Culture/Learning and Development Executive
Job_Descriptions: Raffles Hotel Singapore welcomed guests in August 2019 after a careful and sensitive restoration breathing new life into its beautiful building. One of the few remaining great 19th century hotels in the world, the hotel is perfectly preserved both inside and out, giving it an intoxicating blend of luxury, history and classic colonial design. Its distinctive architecture, legendary heritage and iconic service continue to enthrall visitors where restored suites, new social spaces, restaurants and bars have been enhanced for discerning travellers. No visit to Singapore is complete without a stay here, where the grand historic hotel exudes old-world grandeur infused with the unique charm of the city state. Guests can experience the modern comfort and amenities presented within 115 luxuriously spacious suites complemented by our legendary 24-hour Raffles Butler Service and a heritage tour of the property by our Resident Historian. 10 restaurants and bars present both local favourites, fine dining and collaborations with internationally renowned chefs and curated classics such as the iconic Singapore Sling experience and classic Raffles Afternoon Tea amidst the colonial charm of the historic Grand Lobby. A rooftop swimming pool and state-of-the-art fitness centre provide a respite from the hustle and bustle of the city while the new Raffles Spa is a holistic sanctuary offering pampering spa experiences and renewed well-being. Guests are also invited to visit the Raffles Boutique to shop for gourmet gifts and heritage-inspired souvenirs and a revitalized Raffles Arcade showcasing an elegant mix of new-to-market, and world-renowned international brands, collectively creating a one-of-a-kind retail experience that goes beyond traditional brick and mortar shopping. Official website URL: www.rafflessingapore.com Job Purpose The position is responsible for supporting the Learning and Development Manager in creating, implementing and facilitating the hotel’s Learning and Development plan and budget, ensuring that it is aligned to the hotel’s overall goals and strategic plan as well as for all operational departments to follow through on their training and development commitments.  Assisting with the operations and administrative support to the Talent and Culture operations function, including colleague communication, colleague engagement and talent management. Primary Responsibilities Assists With The Hotel’s Learning & Development (L&D) Needs Analysis And Prepares The L&D Plan And Budget Together with L&D Manager, plans and conducts the hotel’s L&D needs analysis of individual colleagues. Assists in the planning of the hotel’s annual L&D budget, aligning it to the L&D needs analysis. Assists in controlling hotel wide and departmental L&D expenditure within agreed budgets. Creates, Plans And Executes L&D Programmes Together with L&D Manager, designs L&D programmes to meet the competencies of each job function and to address performance gaps. Coordinates and follows up on all corporate, internal and external L&D initiatives and programmes. Assists in the delivery of programmes as assigned by L&D Manager. Informs managers on L&D programme objectives and expected outcomes which colleagues attend. Monitors, measures and reports on colleagues’ L&D plans and achievements within agreed formats and time frame. Adheres To Corporate And Local L&D Regulations Ensures full compliance when coordinating and executing corporate initiated programmes and activities. Ensures that all learning activities meet with relevant statutory and organisational policies and requirements. Adheres to learning requirements set by local authorities and regulations, especially relating to safety and security. These include Basic Food Hygiene, Occupational First Aid, Work at Height, Company Emergency Response Team, etc. Coordinates Industrial Attachment And Internship Programmes Liaises with local and foreign educational institutions to recruit and select students for internship placement in the hotel. Assists with the planning of interns’ L&D schedule in consultation with L&D Manager and functional / departmental managers. Organises regular meetings with L&D Manager and interns to monitor and ensure their welfare. Administers the personal files and records of interns. Maintains engagement with local hospitality institutions through activities such as guest lectures and site visits. L&D Administration Maintains appropriate systems to record and measure necessary aspects of colleagues’ L&D. These include on-the-job learning, internal and external learning, attendance, development plans, etc. Assists in the planning of an ongoing L&D calendar and shares it with management to ensure that learning resources and opportunities are maximised. Organises the learning venue, course notes, attendance sheet and all relevant materials required for classroom learning programmes. Assists in gathering information required to complete monthly accruals, forecast reports as well as corporate reports accurately within specified time frame. Liaises with Workforce Singapore and administers SkillsFuture claims for relevant courses. Involvement In Other Projects & Initiatives Assists and supports the Talent and Culture team in projects and colleague activities as required. Participates and supports sustainability in Corporate initiatives and programmes Performs any other duties and responsibilities that may be assigned.

Job_Title: VP, AML Compliance (Customer Review Unit), Group Retail
Job_Descriptions: VP, AML Compliance (Customer Review Unit), Group Retail VP, AML Compliance (Customer Review Unit), Group Retail Posting Date: 01-Jan-2022 Location: Singapore, SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department You will be part of the Business Compliance-Retail / BRCM AML Customer Review Unit working closely with the Bank's Personal Financial Services. The Customer Review Unit plays a key role to ensure customers' profile and account activities are consistent with regulatory and compliance requirements and the Bank's AML business risk appetite. The Unit provides guidance and partners customer facing teams to identify and mitigate the potential AML/CFT risks. You will keep abreast of regulatory developments in the prevention of money laundering and terrorist financing activities and assess its impact on Group Retail. You will provide interpretation, advisory and recommendations to Business Units on the implementation of AML related practices and due diligence on customers. Job Responsibilities • Conduct holistic assessment on customers' profile and transactional patterns for Sanctions, ML/TF risk • Identify key risk areas and work with relationship managers to ensure suspicious activities are adequately addressed with supporting documentation and institute effective risk mitigating plans • Provide guidance to the business to ensure consistent interpretation and implementation of AML/CFT standards in the review of customer relationships • Recommend account strategy and manage escalations to Group Compliance, Senior Management and Group AML Committee, when required • Manage full suite of customer reviews to ensure timeliness in case closures • Provide advisory to business units for customer on-boarding and retention of customer relationships • Identify regulatory risk and AML/CFT requirements to assess impact and assist Business units to develop processes and controls to manage risks • Conduct investigations into suspected ML/TF activities • Conduct Compliance Training to raise staff awareness on AML/CFT controls, trends and typologies Job Requirements Bachelor's Degree in Banking, Business Management or related fields Relevant 5-8 years of experience in KYC due diligence on Individuals Strong working knowledge of MAS 626 regulations, AML/CFT standards, SOW corroboration, local and cross-border ML/TF typologies and risk mitigation ACAMs certification with experience on AML processes, systems and KYC on SMEs is preferred Strong interpersonal and communication skills Meticulous, analytical and resourceful Proficient in Microsoft office suite of applications Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Our client is a prominent institutional real estate investor with offices globally and exceptional track record in real estate investing, across various asset types including office, logistics, multi-family, retail and mixed-use. Based in Singapore, this is a regional role covering a portfolio of assets in the key gateway cities of the Asia Pacific region. The portfolio consists of both direct and indirect investments, co-investments, joint ventures and club deals. Below are the key responsibilities Assist in formulating and driving asset management strategy to optimize asset performance Execute asset enhancement initiatives to maximize returns Work with local asset asset managers, property managers, acquisitions team and portfolio management team to develop business plans for each asset Liaising with with leasing agents, project managers, JV partners or external consultants to achieve goals of each assets Preparation of reporting of the assets Monitor monthly asset performance, evaluate and report variance analysis against budgets Compute asset returns and undertake portfolio benchmarking Assist in the tracking and roll-out of ESG initiatives Work with various stakeholders on ad-hoc initiatives or projects Requirements: Minimum 1 to 5 years of relevant experience, with exposure to real estate Excellent academic track record Enjoy working in a multi-cultural environment Good financial and analytical skills Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to interact with the senior management professionally Team player and possess fantastic learning attitude Being part of a top tier PERE with the opportunity to work alongside a team of dynamic real estate investment professionals, the successful candidate will pick up best practices of a world class organisation, enjoy great career progression and be rewarded with an attractive remuneration package. Job_Title: Analyst, Intelligent Bank Lead, Consumer Banking Group - WD30044
Job_Descriptions: Business Function As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you. ​​​​​​Job Role The Intelligent Bank team is focused on defining and implementing ‘what’s next’ for DBS after digital, utilising our years of investment in digital capabilities, UX, and real-time customer data, with the objective of creating personalised, relevant, intuitive and meaningful experiences for our customers. We are focused on learning and understanding our customers’ needs, behaviours, motivations and emotions. We explore and discover through customer immersions, experimentation and data. Customer and data insights drives everything we do, from product strategy to design, implementation, go live, and driving results. We work in collaborative, cross-functional squads to solve problems practically, craft and build experiences that will ‘wow’ our customers. Work in a cross-functional manner with product managers, design & research, data science, product delivery, technology and marketing to design, build, test and implement new features of Intelligent Bank Use data to deliver superior customer journeys – from identifying data sources and architecture, to driving data analysis for planned features and customer journeys, to making data-based recommendations and solutions Help drive execution to timelines, including handling unexpected issues and engaging relevant stakeholders in changes Lead, enable and assist a country team (e.g. Indonesia or India) from concept to design, through to build and implementation of Intelligent Bank Develop deep customer insights through customer immersions which will guide product and feature development for each market Requirement Creative spirit, love for design and solving problems Talent and enthusiasm Problem solver with analytical skills Curious about behaviour and culture change Ability to identify and pursue issues end to end until they are resolved Team player, works well with others, manages stakeholders effectively A plus would be a history of building something new through challenges (e.g., building a business, of your own or within a company / department) Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Site Reliability Engineers (Development) Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is an engineering discipline that combines software and systems engineering to build and run large-scale, massively distributed, fault-tolerant systems. SRE is responsible for the availability and reliability of our firm's most critical platform services, and ensures they meet the requirements of our internal and external users. We look for engineers who are motivated to collaborate with our businesses to build and run sustainable production systems, which can evolve and adapt to changes in our fast-paced, global business environment. The Position: Direct exposure to best-in-class Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team, disciplines and tooling Adhere to and drive incident management process and support a blameless post-mortems culture. Develop, support, improve & administer the Firm's primary business-critical trading infrastructure Create and support automation tooling to improve the reliability of the platform and to increase the productivity of the team. Provide critical day-to-day support for a massive scale, distributed system Assess monitoring & alert signals to determine impact and risk to the business and contribute to the incident management process The successful candidate will have outstanding verbal and written communications, a natural ability to learn in a fast-paced environment, and will be a self-starter with plenty of initiative. The Candidate: Proficient in at least one programming language Ability to handle multiple on-going assignments and be able to work independently in addition to contributing as part of a highly collaborative and globally dispersed team Strong analytical skills with the ability to break down and communicate complex issues, ideas and solutions Willingness to learn new languages and programming paradigms (functional programming for example) Previous experience in a blameless SRE environment would be a plus Previous Linux exposure or willingness to learn Good to have Degree in computer science or engineering, or equivalent industry experience Works effectively and thrives in a team while able to operate independently, self-motivation is essential Strong verbal and written communication skills For more information you can email Ganjapan Chamsaeng in our Singapore office on ganjapan.chamsaeng@teksystems.com quoting Job Reference 524085 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest. http://jobs.en-sg.teksystems.com/wCeZIC/site-reliability-engineers-development-itcommunications-singapore-singapore-14806492 Allegis Group Singapore Pte Ltd, Company Reg No. 200909448N, EA License No. 10C4544

Senior Test Manager About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities We are seeking an energetic, talented and motivated individual for the role of Sr. Test Manager on an ongoing Front office Green field project. The job entails testing of a Front Office trading application using the modern technology stack and integrating it with the CI/CD pipeline to enable continuous testing. Lead and own testing process & delivery for defined application stream. Develop automation test strategy, test scripts using inhouse automated testing tools Engage with stakeholders viz., Project Managers, Dev Managers, Test Assurance team, Support teams etc. Assess impact of changes, build functional test strategy and plan Build the functional test plan and strategy for a high volume and low latency application. Work closely with the application development and dev-ops to improve performance, scalability and resiliency of the system. Development of common tools and utilities in Java to capture more detailed metrics from the system logs. Our Ideal Candidate 12+ years of experience in designing, developing and executing the functional & automated testing scripts for a large scale, high volume, low latency enterprise applications. Solid understanding of backend and front-end automated testing and related tooling stack Strong understanding of programming concepts in Java Strong experience & understanding in Behaviour Driven Development (BDD) and related tooling like Cucumber, Gherkin, Selenium Good experience & understanding of CI/CD pipelines, continuous integration and performance testing Good understanding on basic Unix commands Good understanding of Rest APIs and WebSocket based communication. Must possess excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Knowledge of QA and testing standards, methodologies, tools and processes Candidate should have ability to learn new techniques and technologies quickly Analytical Skill: Candidate should be posses' good analytical skills Secondary Skills Experience working with Banking Front Office applications. Good understanding of asynchronous messaging systems like kafka, solace, MQ or similar. Knowledge of QA and testing standards, methodologies, tools and processes Ability to succeed in high energy, dynamic environment Self-driven, good communication skills Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Sofitel and its Ambassadors The Sofitel brand is based on three core values guaranteed by each employee every day:A Passion for Excellence, an Essence of Pleasure and a Spirit of Openness.Through their actions and know-how, the Men and Women that are the creators of Sofitel’s luxury, offer clients a highly personalised service. By transforming every detail into a unique moment of pure comfort and elegance, they create and nurture a relationship with their guests.The Sofitel values are also at the heart of the communication between employees. It is the legacy received and transmitted by all those involved in the brand to guarantee the continuity of the Sofitel spirit in the hotels and headquarters. You must have a passion for excellence, and a can do attitude in order to be considered for this role. Responsibilities: Report directly to the Front Office Manager. The Chef Concierge has a direct supervision over the Concierge, Bell desk, and Valet service. Responsible for the overall Concierge activities within the Hotel. Ensure that the Concierge and the Bell desk department are complying with Hotel standards, policies and procedures. Accept and welcome feedback on performance with the attitude to take action where necessary. Be flexible and adapt to change where required. Previous experience in a five-star environment is desirable, and above all else, pride yourself on ability to build relationships and guest experiences epitomising French elegance, style and sophistication. Discover the life that awaits you at Accor, visit https://careers.accor.com/ Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS

Job_Title: VP, Digital, Data & Technology Program Team Lead, CRESA Group Strategy and Solutions, Technology & Operation
Job_Descriptions: VP, Digital, Data & Technology Program Team Lead, CRESA Group Strategy and Solutions, Technology & Operation Business Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. About CRESA Department DBS Corporate Real Estate Strategy & Administration team (CRESA) is the custodian of DBS' real estate assets while helping to drive the work culture and improve employee experience for the bank. Beyond cost & space optimization, we transform spaces using Digital and Data to foster a culture of collaboration, innovation & teamwork. Globally, we manage more than 5 million square feet of space, ranging from office spaces to more than 750 retail locations. For office spaces, our main goal is to find and build a collaborative workspace to allow colleagues to collaborate and innovate and to drive the culture of the bank. For retail locations, we source and select the best sites, negotiate for the best lease terms and design and build workspaces to achieve the best customer journey & experiences. Above all, our team is also the champion of the bank's environmental sustainability programme, keeping both the office & retail locations as sustainable as we can to build the Best Bank for a Better World. About DDDOM Team in CRESA We are a diverse team comprising technology and data science individuals from related business fields with an aim to use our combined expertise to support our corporate real estate team. We want to embark on this by being digitally-wired, using data to power our real estate decisions and operations while obsessing ourselves with the employee experience. CRESA aims to create innovative space experiences that matter in order to drive the desired culture of DBS and this team will bring the best of Digital Tools and Data Analytics to improve the dynamics of space experiences, services and the systems that encompasses it. About the role We are looking for an experienced, hands-on, Digital Applications and Technology Lead who will support the DDDOM (Digital Data Driven Operating Model) Team in CRESA, within the Technology & Operations unit in DBS. The Digital Applications and Technology Lead is expected to help drive the acquisition and onboarding of digital solution using Agile project management methodology and contribute to the overall creation of the digital applications. The role requires good understanding and application of Agile project management skills and deep knowledge of digital workplace tools and data acquisition tools. The Digital Applications and Technology Lead needs to collaborate with DBS' technology partner and external technology vendors to develop/ maintain Digital Applications to augment CRE functions. Application systems production environment encompasses multiple application software solutions such as Data Governance/Data Quality tool, IoT application platform, IoT sensors, Space Management tool etc., supporting real estate project management, facilities management & lease management. Responsibilities Lead & drive key projects along with internal IT partner & support DDDOM Head for program management Represent CRE in monthly project steering committee forums with IT Partners. Work with internal CRESA business stakeholders to present/update project status, budget drawdown and present projects for approval to proceed etc. in monthly project steering committee forum Work with DDDOM Finance to support DDDOM Head for yearly IT budgeting exercise ensuring all CRESA IT projects/enhancements are accounted for and successfully submitted in GENE system (Bank-wide project budgeting tool) Maintain strong working relationships with key stakeholder teams: Internal business stakeholders, Internal IT Partner/infrastructure/information security and external vendors. Expected to drive improvements through influence and strong relationships with managers in other teams, often who need to execute the changes Run day-to-day functional and business technology support (for CRESA's existing application systems in production) including incident and problem management, root cause analysis while always looking for opportunities to improve processes and controls Correlate events/data across multiple systems to proactively surface and resolve issues Be the go-to person for internal business stakeholders before the projects are being put up for discussion with the Internal IT partners/seniors of the bank Provide business analysis, project management & consultancy and manage software application projects with internal business stakeholders Work with internal IT partner to support project team in vendor management to ensure contractual obligations are met and projects are successfully delivered by vendors Lead & drive vendor & Internal IT partner to report progress and status of the projects and escalate issues/ challenges to the project sponsor/relevant parties Requirements Degree in Business IT or Computer & Information Science or equivalent with minimum 8 years of solution architect experience working in banking or financial institutions within IT industry Prior experience in large scale enterprise application development, capacity planning, optimization, re-engineering, and performance fine tuning - will be an advantage Relevant domain knowledge in implementing technology solution within financial institutions preferred SCRUM Master Certified preferred with experience in agile project implementation and sound knowledge of agile project implementation methodologies Program management (includes business case development, IT budget process management, vendor management and contract governance management) Working knowledge of cyber and information security and cloud computing & services Business analysis and/or hands-on digital transformation experience preferred Strong problem solving and program execution skills while being process oriented Understanding of system resiliency and redundancy requirements Have a strong desire to mentor and coach the teams to continue increasing organization's capabilities Good interpersonal and communication skills, able to communicate well with business users/partners Ability to work well in a team and possess good team management skills. Hands-on attitude towards work with sense of urgency Knowledge of disaster recovery, system backup and restoration methods Knowledge of virtualization technologies/containers, cloud solution implementation (AWS, Azure and/or Google Cloud etc.) Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

To report and update inventory of any losses and breakages discovered after functions. To assist in developing and maintaining the highest standard relating to F&B outlets. To replenish beverage items at Swiss Café (e.g. milk, sugar, coffee beans and tea bags) Qualifications: We are looking for a well-organized and creative candidate with excellent communication and interpersonal skills, who is able to display a “passion for perfection” and work in a dynamic environment. In addition, the candidate should possess: At least 2-3 of year of related experience Good spoken and written English Posses a friendly and attentive personality Good listening and communication skill Able to communicate effectively Chemical knowledge Swissôtel Hotels & Resorts Swissôtel Hotels & Resorts offer broad career development possibilities within a growing international group and competitive conditions of employment. If you feel you are ready for your next professional challenge, send us your application today.

A rooftop swimming pool and state-of-the-art fitness centre provide a respite from the hustle and bustle of the city while the new Raffles Spa is a holistic sanctuary offering pampering spa experiences and renewed well-being. Guests are also invited to visit the Raffles Boutique to shop for gourmet gifts and heritage-inspired souvenirs and a revitalized Raffles Arcade showcasing an elegant mix of new-to-market, and world-renowned international brands, collectively creating a one-of-a-kind retail experience that goes beyond traditional brick and mortar shopping. Job_Title: Lease Administrator - SG MY VN PH
Job_Descriptions: Company Description Do you want to join H&M Group on a journey, defining the way we create a seamless omni customer experience? If you have a genuine passion for growing business and see yourself in a role contributing to added customer value and strong brands – join us and take part in setting how we work to deliver an outstanding omni offer for our customers. The H&M Group operates more than 5000 stores in more than 70 countries with 8 different group brands. We continue to expand worldwide as one of the largest fashion companies in the world. The Expansion function is here to support in adding meaningful growth. We are responsible, in partnership with our brands, for all aspects of creating and maintaining our real estate portfolio: we lease, design, draw, buy, build and maintain each store and constantly follow up on the existing portfolio to ensure high profitability. We add new stores and optimize the current portfolio through rebuilds, extensions, renegotiations, relocations and consolidations. Job Description On this journey we´re all collaborating to create the best omni customer offer for our customers and as a Lease Administrator you will be a key player in making this happen. Together with the team in the region you will develop and streamline documentation best practice to ensure that data is correctly held, abstracted and presented. When people need information from a contract, you will be able to find it for them! Key responsibilities include: Being responsible for the handling of lease documentation, including the signing process Maintaining the data integrity of all physical and electronic lease files Abstracting and providing data in a professional manner Develop and streamline documentation best practice Coaching, training the supporting the team in documentation way of working Internal and external transmittal of documents, reports and notices Data Audits on co-tenancy, key dates, rent terms etc Analyzing, researching and assisting in the resolution of Landlord and Tennant issues Process improvement when it comes to the way in which we handle our lease documentation Partnering with other teams within Expansion as well as other departments to verify lease information and provide support as required. Qualifications We see that you are someone who works in a methodical, structured way and someone who has great attention to detail. You are organised, efficient and have great communication skills that enable you to work with senior stakeholders, both internally and externally. You effectively collaborate with groups of diverse people and you communicate clearly and openly. You are able to manage your workload, prioritise and juggle more than one ball at once! Besides your personality we see that you have: At least 2 years previous experience working with legal documentation and contract management Ability to understand and interpret commercial lease documents and to write routine reports and legal correspondence in a concise and effective manner A proven track record of working efficiently in an organised and structured way Experience in extracting and presenting data in a professional manner Strong time management skills with the ability to adapt and respond to changing conditions and deadlines Ability to manage a large lease database, including inputting, editing and verifying information Attention to detail and strong work ethic Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced work environment while managing various tasks at once Strong sense of customer service for internal and external clients. Additional Information We believe in our people and always encourage new ideas and initiatives. Along with training and leadership guidance, there’s no end to the potential for a successful and global career within H&M. Our goal is for a job at H&M to be more than just a job – it’s the beginning of a career full of opportunities! This is a full-time position, based in Singapore, and you will report to Expansion Manager.

Job_Title: Business Analytics Lead, Digital & Transformation , Global Corporate Banking
Job_Descriptions: Business Analytics Lead, Digital & Transformation , Global Corporate Banking At Global Corporate Banking, we serve a diverse group of domestic and multinational corporations across a range of industries including government agencies, real estate, utilities, infrastructure, healthcare, technology, transportation, commodities and energy amongst others. We have dedicated relationship managers in offices across the world who provide comprehensive and personalised coverage to our clients through deep understanding of their activities and needs. We are looking for an individual with business analytics and storytelling experience in financial services to join the Digital & Transformation Office to help the businesses organise and wrangle valuable information from big data. The individual should be a self-starter, energetic and have a passion for both problem-solving and telling compelling stories using data to business leaders. He/she will also work closely with our colleagues from the Group's data analytics teams as well as Data Analysts and Product Owners of digital transformation projects to solidify Global Corporate Banking's data foundation, drive data-driven decision-making and directly impact divisional automation initiatives and customer experience. We require an individual with an agile and nimble mindset, good understanding of emergent industry tools and best practices in data automation for delivering solutions at a rapid pace. Responsibilities: Translate strategic priorities of Global Corporate Banking into measurable impactful goals to the data analytics team and clearly map out the analytical tools and approach to achieve it. Champion a culture of data-informed decision-making and advance our data capabilities across all business teams. Gather, synthesize and translate data requirements to serve business needs and our customers optimally, perform the required analytics using internal data, and augment it with external data, market data, credit data, partner data, digital data, etc. Make sense of data, analyze trends, draw out insights to explain or support hypotheses, build a story, propose and recommend the solution and next steps to address the business problem or opportunity. Manage day-to day deliverables against the agreed book of work, ensure service levels of the Analytics team are met, target milestones of the initiatives are achieved. Build, coach and mentor a team of Data Analysts to identify, define and solve high impact business problems by ensuring seamless execution, ensuring measurability and clear success metrics, and subsequently follow through on opportunity to optimize the campaigns Communicate effectively to senior stakeholders and present the insights that brought about the experimentation, the test design, the impact and results to the business Ensure clear and organized documentation of the end-to-end requirements to mount successful automated triggers, from basic business requirements, to logic creation, to grooming requirements, validation scenarios, test design, approvals signoffs and success metrics. Contribute to the division's data roadmap and lead the inclusion of lending, trade, deposits, investment banking, treasury and payments-related KPIs into business analytics use cases and outcomes Lead the migration of manual excel reports and dashboards to RM Workbench, build and maintain real-time or near real-time visualizations that helps our coverage teams digest the data and draw out trends and insights easily Leverage on the Enterprise Big Data Platform (EBP) in enhancing the end-to-end process of crafting lending and cross-sell solutions, lead the migration of the countries to a fully automated leads generation from eligibility to pricing assignment, with minimal manual intervention. Understand regulatory implications and develop mitigation and opportunity strategies Ensure robust quantity control in the analytical processes Cross functional leadership (communicating and influencing) to drive towards common goal *LI-JX Qualifications Qualifications: 7+ years of experience in financial services with a focus on Corporate/Institution/Transaction Banking Bachelor's Degree in a relevant field of work, with advance understanding and/or technical experience in SQL and data modelling tools (e.g. Python) Proven track record in strategic thinking, commercial awareness and the ability to frame business problems Excellent analytical, technical and/or statistical skills with proven ability to translate large volumes of data into meaningful narratives An influencer who communicates clearly and frequently to both technical analysts and non-technical business leaders Intellectually curious, consistently seeking and developing new opportunities autonomously Growth mindset - eager to learn and try new things, adapt and thrive in a fast-paced dynamic environment

If you have an architecture or design background and are looking for a creative, fun and purposeful way to transform your career, read on ... The Possible Class is collaborating with Finland’s Arkki to deliver its award-winning program in Singapore. About Arkki (Arkki.com) Arkki is a architeture and creative school for children and youth. Its innovative program uses architecture and design as a medium to advance the learners’ development of critical thinking, innovative skills, creativity and understanding of academic subjects (STEAM and beyond). Since its founding in 1993, Finland, Arkki has organised thousands of activities in more than 20 countries. In Singapore, the innovative program was launched on December 2021 and offers long-term courses and short-term workshops as in- and outside-school activities. We’re primarily targeting learners aged 6-18 and will extend to corporate executives. We invite you to be part of our growing team and join us in this unique journey to shape the future of our learning landscape in the region! Part-time positions are available (with the opportunity to convert to Full-Time). The architecture teacher/creative coach’s responsibilities include leading classes and providing appropriate guidance from knowledge, application, analysis to evaluation and creative generation. As a facilitator, you should ensure that learners interact and collaborate in a supportive and respectful manner. The Arkki’s curriculum is module-based. The coach will need to undergo progressive training for the modules and be certified/equipped with course content to conduct actual classes. Our next module training starts mid-January 2022. Responsibilities Conduct classes in physical setting and virtually, if the situation requires. Able to manage classes with effective timetabling and punctuality. Facilitate, coach, motivate and support young learners, nurturing their enthusiasm towards exploring the wonders of the environment and world around them by inquiring, ideating, hands-on experimenting, concept sharing and collaboration. Apply Arkki’s teaching approach to ensure active learning with a focus on creativity, imagination, problem solving, confident expression and other social competencies. Source creative projects’ supplies, prepare the classrooms and plan lessons. Adapt the course content appropriately for local/regional context as and when required, to enable stronger appreciation of lessons by learners. Assess, record and report student’s progress and development in a timely fashion and provide appropriate feedback to schools and parents. Build strong relationships with parents and work collaboratively with them to ensure learners are supported in their learning journeys. Expectations Ideally 3 years and above of professional experience in architecture or design technology. Candidates with architecture background will have strong advantage. Minimum Bachelor’s Degree. Experience in conducting classes or workshops for children is a plus. Available to work during weekends as well – on rotation basis if required. Team player - hands-on, willing to pick up small tasks, own challenges and go beyond the comfort zone to support team. Be open-minded to learn and apply new teaching methods. Collaborator with good communication and presentation skills. Creative, imaginative and able to think on your feet.

Job_Title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer, Merchant Services, Associate #JPM.
Job_Descriptions: Job Description As a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE), you'll help build a meaningful engineering discipline, combining software and systems to develop creative engineering solutions to operations problems. Much of our support and software development focuses on optimizing existing systems, building infrastructure and reducing work through automation. You’ll join a team of curious problem solvers with a diverse set of perspectives who are thinking big and taking risks. In this environment, you’ll take the lead on relevant projects, supported by an organization that provides the support and mentorship you need to learn and grow. As an SRE, you’ll be focused on running better production applications and systems. J.P. Morgan Merchant Services has embarked on a multi-year effort to build a new, state-of-the-art merchant acquiring platform (“Helix”) that enables commerce around the globe. Delivering on this sizable and complex undertaking requires tight integration and collaboration across technology, product management, business and client readiness. Become a key contributor to the new Helix Payments Platform that is delivering transaction processing for merchants wherever they want it around the globe via any method of payment. Benefits 1) Allow to take a break from caring for the child or intend to travel overseas, capped at 14 days per year. 2) All approved expenses of the child will be paid for, including transportation, milk powder, diapers, etc. A list will be provided. 3) Support and guidelines will be provided.

The Role Responsibilities Strategy Provide threat research, detection content development & technical expertise to the Security Monitoring & Analytics (SMA) Service Line. Business Support the SMA Service Line and contribute to SMA's Threat Use Case Lifecycle in designing and implementing detection use cases. Develop detection methods and security content for current and emerging threats. Contribute to building SMA's knowledge base on threat research. Identify opportunities to improve orchestration, data enrichment and triage capabilities for SOAR. Work closely with content engineering team to monitor and tune alerts. Lead the weekly threat use case forum meetings to support ongoing detection development and enhancements. Conduct research on attack patterns, techniques, and develop creative solutions to detect/prevent adversarial tools, techniques and procedures. Collaborate with the Purple Team to enhance the use case efficacy testing through adversary simulation capabilities. Collaborate with key stakeholders to continuously enhance threat use cases as new products, logs, and capabilities are introduced to the organization. Collaborate with key stakeholders in improving the bank's detection posture. Contribute to automation initiatives that enhance operational effectiveness. Contribute to automation initiatives on cloud platforms (AWS/Azure). Processes Ensure adherence to all internal and external policies, procedures and regulations. Accountable for running, supporting and maintaining various threat use case governance processes. Accountable for enhancing the threat use case lifecycle. Assist and provide expert advice on the best practices in adoption, expansion and implementation of Splunk and its related components. People and Talent Provide stakeholder and peer leadership in cross-functional projects and initiatives. Risk Management Be aware of, identify and escalate all risk issues and concentrations in accordance to the firm's Group Information and Cyber Security Policy. Where appropriate, direct remedial action and/or ensure adequate reporting to Risk Committees. Governance Promote an environment where compliance with internal control functions and the external regulatory framework is a central priority of the service. Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Key Stakeholders Trust, Data & Resilience Cyber Security Services Cyber Defence & Threat Management Cyber Defence Centre Security Monitoring & Analytics Our Ideal Candidate Diploma or bachelor's degree in engineering, Computer Science / Information Technology or its equivalent is preferred. 5 years of relevant industry experience in cyber security. Good knowledge of Splunk Search Processing Language (SPL) for rule and content development for alerting, metrics, and/or reporting. Good understanding of security threats across multiple platforms/environments (e.g., Windows/*nix/Cloud/Mainframe). Good knowledge of Cloud and Container security and in developing security content to detect threats across these (various cloud and container) platforms and/or technologies. Good Scripting Knowledge (bash / Python / SQL DB's / API's). Experience with attacks and mitigation methods, with experience working in two or more of the following: Network protocols and secure network design; Operating system internals and hardening (e.g. Windows, Linux, OS X, Android); Web application and browser security; Security assessments and penetration testing; Authentication and access control; Applied cryptography and security protocols; Security monitoring and intrusion detection, Incident response and forensics; Development of security tools, automation or frameworks. Good to have: Developer or DevOps experience in AWS and/or Azure. Previous experience in Linux/Windows administration & automation. Previous experience as DevOps or DevSecOps is highly beneficial. Previous experience in Splunk App development is highly beneficial Relevant industry certifications (e.g., OSCP, OSCE, GREM, GPEN, GFNA, GCFA) Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. Job_Title: Blockchain Platform Engineer / Developer (Smart Contract, Solidity, etc) Banking
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Vyon Ng Recruiter View profile & contact Experience in troubleshooting & identifying issues as being at the network, operating system, container platform (Kubernetes or Openshift)/ application level OR Experience in Smart contract development and an understanding of cryptography. Advanced proficiency in Solidity and Truffle or Hardhat Knowledge of cryptography and blockchain protocols including best practices in blockchain development and data protection. As a Blockchain Platform Engineer , you will be supporting an enterprise-grade blockchain platform by working with blockchain developers (to ensure that the blockchain platform performs as expected) and platform provider (to troubleshoot issues, perform preventive maintenance and perform updates to the platform without downtime), and documenting the standards, guidelines, processes, insights and lessons learnt. You will monitor (including baseline and monitor the platform’s performance and initiate pre-emptive actions to enhance the capacity) and ensure the platform’s connectivity to the other enterprise systems such as ELK, Nexus repository, LDAP, SMTP gateway and so on are available and working, You will also work with infra, cloud, DevSecOps, infosecurity and risk teams (to ensure the blockchain platform is secure, available and accessible), DevOps team and blockchain developers to develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines required to support the developers and for platform operations and maintenance with the aim to drive & automate everything (as much as possible). Or As a Blockchain Developer , you will design, implement, enhance and support smart contracts on blockchain network by developing and maintaining unit, functional and integration tests for DApps, including CI/CD pipelines for the smart contracts, and documenting the APIs, coding standards, processes, decisions, issues, insights and lessons learnt. You will work with multiple stakeholders, namely business users, business analysts, architects, DevSecOps, infosecurity and risk teams to design and deliver DApps, and other development teams to ensure end-to-end design and delivery. You will need to keep up with current blockchain landscape and cryptographic approaches (such as zero knowledge proofs) and ensure the DApps developed comply with best practices in secure coding and data protection. To qualify, individuals must possess: For Blockchain Platform Engineer - Experience working on & supporting container platforms such as Kubernetes or Openshift, blockchain platform training will be provided. Must have: - Experience in troubleshoot by identifying issues as being at the network, operating system, container platform/ application level - Knowledge of Helm chart scripting and troubleshooting. - Familiarity with Nexus, Bitbucket, Confluence and Jira. Good to have: - Experience in setting up Bitcoin, Ethereum, or other blockchains - Jenkins pipeline DSL, Bash scripting and Terraform For Blockchain Developer - Experience supporting DApps in mainnet or production environment. - Familiarity with container platforms such as Kubernetes or Openshift, Bitbucket, Confluence and Jira. Must have: - Experience in smart contract development and an understanding of cryptography. - Expertise translates into secure, efficient and scalable DApps. - Advanced proficiency in Solidity and Truffle or Hardhat - Knowledge of cryptography and blockchain protocols including best practices in blockchain development and data protection. Good to have: - Frontend prototyping using React, Java programming, PostgreSQL and Jenkins pipeline DSL. Senior Qualitative Researcher Overview : A leading Tech company requires a Senior Qualitative Researcher to collaborate with its global team to drive and improve a leading Health product in Singapore. The right candidates will be excellent communicators, knowledgeable about product development and design, curious about the relationship between technology and work, comfortable in a fast-moving organisation, excited to collaborate, and passionate about understanding and helping people. If this sounds like you, come join us as we work to solve complex and meaningful problems! Responsibilities : Work closely with product teams to identify research initiatives. Design hypotheses and lead studies that examine both user behaviour and attitudes. Generate actionable insights that both fuel ideation and evaluate design / product experiences. Conduct research using a wide variety of qualitative methods Conduct semi-structured interviews Communicate results and illustrate suggestions in compelling and creative ways. Act as a thought leader in the domain of research, while advocating for the people who could use our products. Ability to ask, as well as answer, product and user experience related questions. Experience with a range of qualitative methods including but not limited to interviews, contextual inquiry, concept testing, and diary studies. Ability to handle complex information and adapt to a changing environment. Basic understanding of quantitative, behavioral analysis and statistical concepts. Ability to communicate research results to cross-functional stakeholders with data storytelling, presentation slides, and storytelling. Job_Title: Business Planning Manager, TB & TB COO
Job_Descriptions: Business Planning Manager, TB & TB COO About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities The role holder will report to the Head of Strategic Initiatives & Business Management and support the Transaction Banking COO, as well as central TB Front Office activities. The role will entail a degree of flexibility and pro-activeness alongside a head for numbers and the ability to explain in simple terms complex information. The role holder will be focused on driving results through monitoring and tracking of business performance, budgets, risk and audit related matters and establishing and maintaining appropriate processes/mechanisms for efficient tracking and monitoring. Also responsible for planning, co-ordination and project management of specific business projects and initiatives. Business Management & Planning Tracking: Day-to-day business management for the TB business, including monitoring and tracking of business performance, budgets, costs, headcount, risk and audit related matters and establishing and maintaining appropriate processes. Closely monitor the development and performance of business-critical issues. Project Management: Responsibility for the planning, co-ordination and project management of specific business projects and initiatives for TB COO and TB FO as required. Efficiency: Continuously improve business management efficiency by simplifying and standardizing operational processes and procedures. Identify and implement best practices in resources and processes, ensuring consistency and relevance. Meeting Coordination: Prepare reports, presentations, papers, and review material to support discussions and decision making at various forums (e.g. Monthly Business Review, TB Governance forums, CCIB forums etc). Organise/coordinate business meetings and escalations with stakeholders and support functions. Compliance: Responsibility for ensuring the TB business operates in full compliance with Product Programmes, and all relevant Group Risk Policies and Codes of Conduct, as well as ensuring satisfactory Audit reports. Performance Management Management Information: Support the delivery of MI to meet the needs of TB. Team Support: Assist in talent management, P3 process, learning and development initiatives such as training workshops, learning curriculums, staff surveys, certification programs, etc. Financial: Act as a knowledge expert on the product sets and operations, including financials (P&L, Balance sheet, KPI's etc). Provide suggestions to improve profitability & performance and implement any approved recommendations. Strategic Inputs Liaison: serve as liaison with stakeholders to effectively manage priorities and facilitate good outcomes. Initiatives: Assist with strategic planning including the development and production of strategic plans, management reviews, performance updates, and associated research, analysis, and presentation. Problem Solving: Based on data gathered across TB FO and TB COO, support in solving operational, financial, sales and service issues. Communication Internal: Work with internal communication teams to ensure business engagements are represented (e.g., business update, appointments, team calls, town halls, press release, Bridge, media interviews). External: Support brand / marketing related activities (e.g., client events, industry / proprietary forums, etc) and external party meetings (i.e. consultants, vendors, auditors, regulators, clients, media/publications, etc). Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Effectively and collaboratively support each Business Leader to identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Key Stakeholders Head of Business Management & Strategic Initiatives, Transaction Banking TB COO TBMT Members TB COO MT Members Client Coverage Service Management Team members TB Product and Country Management Team members Global Business team members, across CCIB and CPBB under the context of banking the ecosystem of our clients SCB Strategy, Operational Risk, Finance, Group Treasury, HR, Legal, Credit Risk, Compliance etc Business Managers in other parts of SCB Our Ideal Candidate 8+ years of Banking experience, ideally with exposure to Business Management Project and Program Management skills/qualifications Experience managing data, and using tools to include Power BI, Tableau and Microsoft applications. Outstanding written and verbal communication skills. Creative problem-solver with good multi-tasking skills, able to prioritise issues and resolve them efficiently. Mature self-starter who can quickly get up to speed and take a strategic view. Ability to work on broad strategic projects as well as day-to-day process-oriented tasks. Strong organisational skills and process discipline in order to drive multiple agendas. Flexibility and responsiveness in order to handle changing priorities and urgent requests from senior management. Ability to engage stakeholders well in both a one-to-one relationship and team environment. Maintain discretion in dealing with highly confidential information. Multi cultural awareness. Proven success of working effectively with people of different backgrounds. Excellent knowledge of MS Office - Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel a must. Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Leveraging on financial information, analysis and insights to help drive desired outcomes, your key responsibilities include: Support the leadership team on all aspects of financial planning and analysis including controlling, analyzing and reporting on business performance on a periodic basis. Responsible for the preparation of annual budget, financial forecast and ad-hoc reporting. Provide financial recommendation, work with internal stakeholders and Finance team to substantiate variances between actual, rolling forecast and budgeted numbers and identify areas to mitigate risks. Perform impact analysis by applying scenario tools to cost and provide support to costing review with Business Units. Recommend areas for improvement of costs allocation and processes to drive efficiency. At least 8 years of relevant experience in management reporting / business partnering, or work in analytical roles in the financial industry would be advantageous. Able to articulate the financial story/strategy and provide insights/recommendations to stakeholders including senior management. Detail oriented individual capable of completing reporting and analytics accurately and on a timely basis. Demonstrate ability to build and maintain effective working relationships with all levels of management and staff. Capacity and desire to work both at a strategic and detailed analysis level. An independent, self-starter who is able to thrive in a fast paced and changing environment.

The Role Responsibilities Strategy Define, communicate and implement Standard Chartered Bank's Technology Vision aligned to the T&I Strategy and Bank Strategy Define the roadmap and govern the execution to establish a Software Defined Bank and to achieve our aspirations to be a global financial services organisation leveraging IT capabilities that are 100% in the cloud Define, make real and govern architecture bank wide supporting Standard Chartered Bank as well as our Standard Chartered Ventures initiatives. Establish architecture as an enabler of speed to market, not a blocker, adopting New Ways of Working to support an iterative build-based approach Business Embed a client led mindset focused on the continuous delivery of value aligned to bank strategy Enterprise Architecture - Define and embed an Enterprise Architecture capability to build the foundations, frameworks, enablers and overarching governance to accelerate our delivery, execute efficiently and ensure our services both remain secure (by design) and meet minimum regulatory requirements. Target State - Define and own the technology target state for all of our foundational enablers globally being cloud, data, end user, infrastructure, integration, networks and security. Agile Governance - defining and operating architectural governance in a manner that involves conversation, feedback and interaction and promotes faster delivery and sustainable outcomes. Ensure succession planning is in place for critical roles. Act quickly and decisively when any risk and control weakness becomes apparent and ensure they are addressed within an appropriate timeframe and escalated through the relevant committees. Include all necessary internal, legal and regulatory controls through the development of Journeys Technology requirements. Balance business performance delivery and cost management constraints with risk and control matters to ensure that they do not materially threaten the Group's ability to remain within risk appetite. Ensure a full understanding of the risk and control environment in area of responsibility. Governance Responsible for assessing the effectiveness of the Group's arrangements to deliver effective governance, oversight and controls in the business and, if necessary, oversee changes in these areas Awareness and understanding of the regulatory framework, in which the Group operates, and the regulatory requirements and expectations relevant to the role. Responsible for delivering 'effective governance'; capability to challenge fellow executives effectively; and Willingness to work with any local regulators in an open and cooperative manner. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Job_Title: VP, Fraud MIS Head - Fraud Risk Management
Job_Descriptions: VP, Fraud MIS Head - Fraud Risk Management OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world's most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody's. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World's Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Group Risk Management (GRM) is an independent function responsible for ensuring that risk management practices at OCBC Bank are effective and comprehensive. GRM builds and drives the Bank's businesses through an integrated risk management approach relying on strong risk analytics to support strategic business decision-making and to create a competitive edge for the Group. This position will be sitting in the Operational Risk Management department of GRM. Purpose of the role The Fraud MIS Head is focused on strengthening Group Fraud Risk Management (FRM) capabilities in fraud detection, fraud prevention and fraud response, through developing and deploying machine learning models, and providing insights into performance of the Group's fraud detection systems and processes using data analytics. The incumbent is expected to: Lead and play an active role in the development and deployment of machine learning models to strengthen capabilities of the Fraud Surveillance System (FSS) and Anti-financial Malware System (AFMS); Provide leadership and guidance on the use data analytics to increase the value and effectiveness of both the FSS and AFMS, and to recommend for parameter changes, where necessary; Actively participate in the deployment of future phases of the FSS and AFMS in the Group; Understand the latest fraud trends, detection techniques and machine learning models, with a view to integrate into the Group's fraud detection systems. Key Responsibilities Work closely with FRM and their partners to understand current and emerging fraud trends. Maintain a deep and thorough understanding of the capabilities of the FSS and AFMS. Develop, deploy and maintain machine learning models for detection of suspected fraudulent transactions. Lead the MIS team in monitoring the performance and effectiveness of the FSS and AFMS by applying statistical techniques to identify opportunities to improve the performance of both systems. Based on the results of these analyses, create new rules or enhance the parameters of existing rules, after obtaining the appropriate approvals. Work closely with FRM to understand existing analytics and machine learning capabilities, and propose, develop and deploy such capabilities. Play a 'technical consultant' role and be recognized as a subject-matter-expert on fraud-related data analytics. Maintain a strong understanding of the range of fraud detection/prevention techniques and capabilities in the market, and share knowledge on the capabilities of other fraud monitoring systems, data analytics and operational models. Play an active role in relevant projects, which may be made up of participants within and outside of Operational Risk Management Corporate Security (ORM CS). Demonstrate a flexible approach to work, identifying and taking on the tasks which will add value to the roles and responsibilities of FRM. Conform to company's performance management policies and procedures. Qualifications The ideal Candidate will meet the following requirements: Masters / Degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics, economics, or other quantitative fields. At least 5 years of experience in data analytics preferably in the financial industry focusing on business intelligence analysis, data engineering, or related fields. Experience track record of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasets. 1 to 3 years in practical fraud risk management roles would be an added advantage. Developed Machine Learning models would be a strong advantage. Experience in developing MIS reports and conducting analytics for system parameter changes. Must be able to speak, read, write and understand the primary languages used in the workplace. Additional language skills are advantageous for this post but not essential. Independent, resourceful and enthusiastic with a high sense of integrity. Systematic approach with good organization and planning skills. Advanced data analytics skills and knowledge in developing and deploying machine learning models. Advanced knowledge of big data technologies, SQL, Python, and in developing data models, ETL Development, and Data Warehousing. Proven success in communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe data modelling and analytical decisions and data engineering strategy. Able and willing to work under intense pressure. At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us. *We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified.

· Are you a confident mid-level Software Developer looking for a new challenge? · Are you an expert in SQL with exposure to other programming languages such as VBA, Python or R? · Can you hit the ground running in a role reporting into the UK while playing a critical role to support clients and internal teams across the UK? · Do you want to work in the exciting business insights industry? **In return, you can expect a competitive salary (up to $7k per month depending on experience), 20 days annual leave, group healthcare, a hybrid working environment, and more. You’ll need to be comfortable stretching your day till around 7pm, given you’ll be working closely with your European counterparts. However, you’ll benefit from flexibility and freedom (and potentially a later start time) during your working day to make this more comfortable. Please note, our client is unable to sponsor a visa for this position** Our client is a global business intelligence and consultancy business focused on a wide range of industries including commodities and energy markets. With 27 offices globally, they are a world-leader in their field. Reporting to the UK head office, we are looking for a mid-level developer to join their growing global data team. You are expected to be an expert in SQL. The clients current systems rely on VBA so experience of this or a willingness to be trained in it are required. Moving forward there is expected to a greater reliance on other programming languages like Python, so experience of this or willingness to be trained is advantageous. You will work closely with internal clients of the data team to support and maintain R, Excel and database-based processes for gathering data, calculating prices and producing the reports and data feeds. The work also involves writing robust automated processes in R. So what will you do? This is an integral and critical position for the Asia Pacific business - you will be gathering requirements from internal teams as well as supporting with client queries on data. In this role you will… · Develop, maintain, deliver and support a series of defined reports and analysis within the Data function · Enhance existing VBA automations and write robust automated processes in R · Maintain, develop and enhance existing/new systems which will include metadata modification, data cleansing and data checking · Assist with the development of various models and reporting tools · Develop applications and tools that analyse data for better insights and business intelligence, all the while ensuring solutions are innovative yet practical · Support customers with the integration of client’s data and metadata into customer systems Desired Skills and Experience · Several years of experience of developing tools using at least one of the following platforms (R, SQL, VBA in MS Excel) in a commercial (work) environment · Relevant academic qualification such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics or related · Good knowledge and experience of SQL, preferably in Oracle, including stored procedures, functions and triggers · Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and Unit Testing in R is required. · Comfortable working in a fast-moving environment with changing requirements · Experience in visualisation techniques · Ability to interact with non-technical people in plain language · Ability to work both as part of a global/remote team · Self-motivated with ability to work independently, prioritising tasks to meet deadlines
