ED Working Capital Advisory About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Strategy, P&L and Working Capital Proposition The Working Capital Advisor is responsible for development of strategy, building the Working Capital proposition and its execution aligned to working capital needs of our clients. Strategy and Building Working Capital Proposition Articulating the Working Capital vision - to all stakeholders including CC, TB and broader CCIB team both in group and in the countries. Ensuring that Working Capital capabilities are build and commercialised across the bank's global network. Create Industry level decks and data on Working Capital metrics Develop and commercialize Working Capital proposition for new economy and services sector Understanding Client's Working Capital needs and challenges to size future opportunities Capture competitor intelligence and regulatory information and use it to develop or reinforce our competitive edge to improve sales & marketing performance Financial Performance: Product P/L Management Product P/L ownership for the Working Capital initiative Deliver budget, through active management of: Revenue (existing and new revenue streams) Work with CC Industry leads / RMs/ TB Sales to structure, propose and execute bespoke Working Capital Solutions to clients including driving co-creation of Working Capital Solutions. Create or co-create (with clients) including but not limited to industry solutions/structures for Working Capital by benchmarking the client's Working Capital metrices with their industry peers and propose solutions to move client's working capital metrices to the agreed / desired outcome. Delivers new revenue streams with meaningful returns over the long term, through Working Capital Solutions, whilst uplifting current revenue streams through innovative solutions and cross-sell. Leads process design work with Operations, Technology and other function partners with the aim of ensuring that the Working Capital deals proposed to clients are operationally executable. Commercialization of Working Capital suite of capabilities Develops a Working Capital commercialization plan which integrates product positioning with client value propositions all adapted to the industries and markets of our clients. Works closely with RMs / TB Sales: based on data and business intelligence from Working Capital Analytical tools to identify and execute of opportunities Conduct regular reviews of the Working Capital offerings to ensure a "fit for purpose" operating plan. Responsible for commercialization of Working Capital solutions for an Industry including developing commercialization plans, targets and ensuring infrastructure requirements are resourced. React to new trends and technology and provide feedback to link those with current Working Capital offering and impact to clients. Work closely with Technology and Channels team to realize the objective of Digitisation. Risk Management Builds deep and comprehensive knowledge of Working Capital metrices for an industry and leverages that to manage the risk with clients. Takes the initiative regarding regulatory, reputational, and ethical matters by providing proactive advice to sales and implementation teams. Ensures adherence with the highest standards of ethics, and compliance with relevant policies, processes, and regulations. Client Engagement Support for Key RFP and critical deals; strategic clients and those high-potential names for increasing the trade and swift market share penetration Maintain high level of client contact, including client forums, workgroups, industry events and client meetings to ensure continuous improvement and positioning of Standard Chartered solutions. Monitor competitive positioning and provide comparison / positioning analysis for use by Sales / Coverage and also drive new initiatives Support CC Industry Leads with objective of Working Capital wallet expansions across CCIB segments Governance Responsible for all product risks for the Working Capital Solutions Identifies and mitigates operational, credit, regulatory, legal, fraud and risks in their Working Capital Solutions offerings. Evaluates current processes via a business Conduct lens. Defines pricing guidelines and processes for the product. Conducts regular engagement with risk owners, NFRC members on product related risks, PPG changes, that emanate from the Working Capital Solutions. Understands compliance, AML and FCC risk and applies appropriate risk mitigation processes. Conducts regulatory reviews on their products in partnership with Legal and Compliance. Brand, Marketing & Training Conduct training and workshop for internal stakeholders (i.e., TB/Sales/RMs/CSG/CRC/CDU/TMU/Credit etc) on Working Capital Solutions. Regular webinars and engagement with Sales, Coverage and Operations to further strengthen Working Capital Solutions knowledge. Our Ideal Candidate Graduate, post-graduate in Finance / MBA preferred 12+ years of Banking Experience with 3 years in Product Management with proven track record of growing a business line with new ideas. Very good working knowledge with hands-on experience of Working Capital products like Short Term Loans, OD, Trade Finance, Cash Management etc. Very good consultative, analytical skills including problem solving skills Strong communication and interpersonal skills to influence directly, indirectly and virtually across the SCB network. Open minded with ability to explore new areas and new ways of working Ability to keep abreast on changes in the market, customer requirement, competitor response and the Banks ability to use information to identify new business opportunities. Good understanding of financial regulation impacting Banking viz Basel, IBOR, Risk Weighted Assets etc. Proven ability to commercialize these regulatory requirements internally & towards clients in form of internal directions around operational / investment balances and positioning of same with clients. Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

What will you be doing? Assisting in FX & interest rates trade execution including deal set up, pricing, booking, client KYC and legal onboarding Undertaking research and monitoring developments/trends in the market Working with the firm's various product teams across M&A, Equities, Debt and Equity related capital market activity. Engaging with clients to understand their needs and provide solutions to client issues and also support origination of products to benefit from market opportunities Having a keen interest in market trends, a quantitative analytical mindset and a hunger to become a derivative solutions expert. Developing effective working relationships and to demonstrate a strong commitment to the Firm's goals and values What we're looking for: Degree educated or equivalent work experience within a similar role Excellent communication skills both written and verbally in English, Fluency in an additional major Asian language would be an advantage The Ability to uphold and maintain internal controls and procedure processes Good knowledge of all FX and Rates risk management products Skills that will help you in the role: The Ability to consistently produces high-quality, accurate work in a timely manner Previous experience managing multiple assignments and handles pressure well Demonstrates an understanding of basic accounting, finance, and the capital markets Previous experience of taking ownership of projects and drives the process but also knows when to ask for help Where will you be working? Our office is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre, which has been carefully crafted into a "city in a garden". Overlooking the scenic skyline along the Marina Bay waterfront, the green spaces and rooftop terraces have been designed to optimise employee well-being. The centre provides an integrated live-work-play development, surrounded by shops, restaurants, gyms and an alfresco dining area. Our convenient office location means you're just a 5-minute walk from the nearest MRT station.

Job_Title: Software Engineer - Asset Management (AMD) Federation Engineering
Job_Descriptions: Software Engineer - Asset Management (AMD) Federation Engineering ENGINEERING What We Do At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don't just make things - we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets . Engineering, which is comprised of our Technology Division and global strategists groups, is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here. Who We Look For Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment. The successful candidate will be an integral part of the Asset Management Engineering team, with primary focus on Asset Management Division (AMD) Federation business support. The candidate will work closely with the technology as well as business counterparts, both locally, regionally, and globally, to identify optimal solution to facilitate existing as well as new business needs. Responsibilities range from system development covering the entire software development lifecycle (SDLC), support and maintenance oversight including both in-house and vendor applications. Software Engineer - Entitlements Platform At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don't just make things - we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets. The Entitlements Platform team is responsible for protecting the firm against the risks associated with both over-privilege and under-privilege and builds the required logical security controls which facilitate firm's mandatory adherence to regulatory and compliance policies. We help the firm manage the security risks associated with identity and privilege by providing products that can easily be integrated by the firm's other software engineers; as well as offering management tools to approve, recertify and report on staff privileges. We are looking for software engineers who want to build robust control solutions and who understand the need for platforms that can achieve leverage across the enterprise. As a software engineer on the team you will build applications, libraries and services to manage the lifecycle of application privileges; provide externalized authorization capabilities; and allow secure, auditable access to the firm's technology production environment. Basic Qualifications: The ability to communicate technical concepts effectively, both in writing and orally, as well as the interpersonal skills required to collaborate effectively with colleagues across diverse technology teams Proficiency in designing, developing and testing cross-platform software Solid experience of version control, continuous integration, deployment and configuration management tools The ability to understand and effectively debug both new and existing software Strong core and server-side Java software development experience (Java 8 or higher) Experience implementing REST APIs and microservice architecture Self-motivated and ability to work in high paced environment with tight deadlines Preferred Qualifications: A grounding in identity and privilege management concepts, including relationships between employee and privilege lifecycle, authorization vs. authentication, and segregation of duties Familiarity with SQL and/or NoSQL databases, database design principles and object-relational mapping frameworks null

Job_Title: VP, Wealth Management Product Marketing, Group Retail
Job_Descriptions: VP, Wealth Management Product Marketing, Group Retail VP, Wealth Management Product Marketing, Group Retail Posting Date: 31-Dec-2021 Location: Singapore, SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services. Personal Financial Services We design and provide products and services that empower our customers to enjoy greater banking convenience while they extract more value from their money. In particular, we are focused on promoting and developing healthy saving and investment practices across generations. Job Responsibilities • Seeking to hire a Vice President (VP) within UOB's Group Retail Marketing team who will drive the overall marketing of the bank's wealth/investment products as well as solutions that promote sustainability. • The individual is responsible for overseeing and managing all strategic and tactical marketing activities and campaigns in these areas, extending to both existing, as well as new product/solution launches. • He/she will have to work closely with internal stakeholders across the sales, segment, product, compliance and legal teams as well as external partners to plan, develop and execute campaigns to help drive client acquisition and deepen client engagement to support the delivery of business outcomes. • This individual is also tasked with ensuring continuous marketing activities aimed at raising awareness of the bank's value proposition in the area of wealth; as well as promoting the bank's omni-channel approach towards delivering wealth solutions. In addition, he/she will be responsible for supporting the bank's strategic drive in forging a sustainable future and helping consumers live sustainably through marketing its financing, payments as well as sustainable investing solutions and proposition. • When running campaigns, he/she will be required to provide clear direction and work with creative and social agencies to develop effective assets across the full range of paid and owned channels. He/she will also be expected to have experience and capabilities across traditional and digital marketing, working with the media agency to determine the media mix, target and retarget audiences effectively; and optimise media spends for campaigns. • The individual is likewise responsible for managing allocated marketing budgets, including monitoring the marketing effectiveness of spends in driving marketing and business objectives. Job Requirements • At least 10 years of marketing experience in a financial institution (FI) or managing FI accounts in a creative agency • Degree in Marketing, Communications, Business or Economics • Demonstrate creativity and the ability to express opinions on creative work; strong digital and social media marketing experience is essential • Good understanding of wealth/investment products is preferable • Robust project management skills - able to prioritise and manage multiple projects in a fast paced environment while maintaining attention to detail • Possess business acumen, with a keen eye on the competitive landscape and a strong ability to help drive results while adapting to business needs and challenges • Strong communicator (written and spoken) who is able to build and deepen internal and external stakeholder relationships Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Software Engineering - Listed Clearing Listed Clearing Engineering is responsible for the implementation of the systems and processes that support Goldman Sachs derivatives clearing business. We support over 40 clearing venues across the world. Every future or option that GS clears for ourselves or for our clients comes through our systems, that's about 800k a day. We have several applications that make this happen. Most of these need to cope with high throughput, have rich operational functionality and handle significant financial exposure. They include: Clearing venue connectivity Matching algorithms Trade booking and event processing flows Data lake for analytics Client Reporting We are embarking on an exciting journey to re-build our Listed Derivative Architecture which entails building our connectivity, matching and shaping function over the sequencer platform. We will be replacing our existing applications stack with strategic stacks in phases. We are looking for motivated developers who can join us on our exciting journey as we change our Listed Derivative world. HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL Translate business and technical requirements into well-engineered business applications based on object oriented design and event driven model. Interface with internal client's/end users and other development teams Participate in the full SDLC for software development to be written in JAVA, React, Sybase, DB2, EMS, Kafka, micro services with event driven architecture. Responsible for L3 production support of global users Developer will be a part of global team that will provide support for listed clearing matching and reconciliation SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WE ARE LOOKING FOR Bachelor/Master degree in Computer Science or related technical field involving programming or systems engineering. Proficiency in building software in one or more of the following: JAVA, React, Kafka, Sybase, Db2, EMS, micro service architecture. Good at algorithms, data structures and software design. Experience with UNIX operating systems internals. Experience with object oriented programming & Java design pattern. Strong communication skills Should be able to work independently Should be able to manage user communication. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Experience in Sequencer paradigm or event driven architecture is a plus. Experience with distributed systems design, maintenance, and troubleshooting. Hands-on experience with debugging and optimizing code. Strong communication skills, drive, and ownership. Experience applying DevOps principles to novel problems and systems Derivative products & clearing functional knowledge (but not required). ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world. We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. This role designs and execute the pricing strategy to achieve key margin accretion objectives across different franchises of Zimmer Biomet in APAC. This role engages with relevant internal Commercial & Marketing business leaders, and finance & analytics team across APAC to execute price setting, price getting and price netting processes for our most relevant brands. Price Setting Develop and roll-out a standardized price setting methodology across APAC, including list price setting at country level. Responsible for understanding company products and their value added, knowing competitor pricing matched with market expectations to determine the ideal target price for products Develop a guidance process and communication plan for price setting education Price Getting Assist in the implementation of a consistent exception handling approach across APAC. Develop and roll-out pricing bands and floor prices for key brands and countries Communicate and enforce layers of approvals within APAC Price Netting Develop and implement a structured approach to identify margin leakage throughout key brands and countries in APAC Collect and use data to identify price erosion opportunities Develop a feedback mechanism to improve price setting and getting thorough insights generated from the data gathered Pricing Performance Management & Reviews Develop and roll-out standardized pricing performance tracking and review processes for quarterly assessment on key brands & countries Lead internal pricing meetings to ensure metrics are clearly understood and acted upon Pricing Dashboards / Reports Development & Implementation: Create dashboards of Pricing KPIs to be used by APAC and local teams to measure pricing performance and instill a culture of analysis, learning and improvement Monitor sales data, run analyses, track changes in pricing data and quantify impact of price, volume and mix into price variances Design a system to track pricing escalations, price corridors and brand performance across different countries This is not an exhaustive list of duties or functions and may not necessarily comprise all of the "essential functions". Minimum qualifications: JD degree or equivalent practical experience. 7 years of experience working in a Competition Counsel role. Experience practicing law in a relevant jurisdiction. Preferred qualifications: 8 years of practice of competition law in Singapore and APAC. Experience with European competition law study and practice. About the job As Corporate Counsel at Google, you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and work with Googlers from all over the company. As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well. The Competition Legal team works on an entire spectrum of competition investigations, litigation, Mergers and Acquisitions, and advisory across all product areas. Team members work with a number of cross-functional teams and stakeholders, and interact frequently with regulators. 20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for working with some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you address unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world. Resposibilities Lead competition investigations in Singapore and across APAC. Analyze and advise on competition aspects on product launches relating to Singapore and APAC. Collaborate with the Competition team and cross-functionally to develop a holistic strategy.

A Day in the Life Senior Manager Southest Asia Service & Repair This role will have both operational and commercial responsibilities across the SEA S&R landscape. This role will primarily be responsible to deliver best in class service & repair, operational performance, service commercialization opportunities and customer experience. The role will develop S&R capabilities into a competitive advantage which differentiates Medtronic in the eyes of our customers to make S&R a strong reason to buy from Medtronic. The SEA S&R leader will be responsible to integrate and build a high performing organisation of ~42 employees serving all OUs across field service, depot service, technical support, and service commercialization. The role will further develop and deliver on a transformation roadmap for S&R for SEA, standardizing process and technology and developing new operating models to deliver superior service, cost, and quality outcomes. The role will partner closely with commercial and therapy leaders in SEA, as well as our distributors, to complement commercial strategies, whilst defining and operationalizing the service commercial blueprint to ensure sustainable, profitable revenue growth for the business. Responsibilities: Delivers on the operational and financial objectives of the SEA S&R business. Develop and implement strategy to provide best in class customer experience, operational performance, employee productivity, and service commercialization in SEA Service & Repair. Responsible for leading a pan-MDT field service team, depot repair team, technical support, and service coordinator teams – approx. 42 people. This role will also carry reporting responsibilities for the service commercialization team based in SEA. Develop and lead a high performing culture and organisation which delivers superior service, cost, and quality outcomes for our customers. Establish standard service delivery and commercial metrics, operating mechanisms, and service level agreements across all Operating Units to ensure consistent and excellent service levels for Medtronic customers. Establish a clear and aggressive service commercialization strategy in partnership with the commercial and therapy leadership and SEA service commercialization team. Define key success factors, with clear roles and responsibilities across the various teams, to ensure consistent service revenue growth and profitability. Play a leading role in identifying and operationalizing new service technologies (e.g. remote service, XR) aimed at improving operational efficiency and customer experience, whilst providing a differentiating factor to increase service contract penetration. Drive innovation / operational excellence to improve productivity across all teams, such as AI automation, promote MOS (Medtronic Operating System) and COS (Cell operating system) to service & repair operations Drive process excellence across all teams; implement best practices and process standardization across the service delivery and service commercial landscapes. Collaboratively work with the APAC S&R leadership team to share and implement best practices in SEA. Continuously determine customer service requirements by maintaining contact with customers; visiting operational environments; conducting surveys; benchmarking best practices; analyzing information and applications and finding ways to delight MDT customers. Skills and Attributes: High levels of integrity and compliance Strong customer focus Strong focus on strategic thinking and details for execution Excellent interpersonal skills. Able to communicate effectively at different levels of hierarchy internally and externally. Excellent stakeholder management skills: Ability to work effectively in a global matrix organization across geographic and functional boundaries. Strong team management, talent development and coaching skills Strong change management skills Strong commercial awareness and sound business and commercial acumen Demonstrates initiative and innovation to generate ideas and solutions in different situations Can work autonomously but is also a team player Results orientated - Self-motivated and positive Ability to handle ambiguity Energetic, outgoing and respect people – a people person Solution orientated with a “can do” attitude and proactive nature Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required Minimum of 7 years of relevant experience with 5+ years of managerial experience, or advanced degree with a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience with 5+ years of managerial experience Nice to Have Bachelor Degree in any disciplines 15+ years’ experience working in Supply Chain / Service & Repair field with a sound understanding of end-to-end operations and/or service commercial management. 10+ years leadership experience of managing managers in a large organization (preferably in Medical Device industry) Demonstrated experience in holding people and organizations accountable to meeting established standards and service levels (preferable in medical device industrial) Demonstrated experience in managing large cross functional changes (driving innovation, org transformation, change management) Proven experience in functional P&L management is also preferred. Demonstrated ability working successfully in a global, complex stakeholder environment Demonstrated project management experience in leading operational excellence (applying lean, sigma methodology, etc.) Computer literacy including sound knowledge of the MS Office suite of software. Extensive knowledge of Medical device products and service models Other Comments: Some out of hours work will be required Some interstate/international travel will be required (regularly / occasionally) About Medtronic Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be. We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future. Senior Quality Manager A Day in the Life Leads the Quality System development and deployment in the Medtronic Singapore Operations (MSO) facilities. Ensures products manufactured in MSO meet all defined specifications and are developed and manufactured in compliance with all applicable quality system requirements. Provides leadership and support for Customer Focused Quality, Quality Engineering and Quality System improvement initiatives. Key Responsibilities: Provides oversight for the development and maintenance of quality programs, systems, processes and procedures that ensure compliance with policies and that the performance and quality of services conform to established internal and external standards and guidelines. Provides expertise and guidance in interpreting policies, regulatory and/or governmental regulations, and internal regulations to assure compliance. Provides guidance and coaching to all direct reports, includes establishing individual performance & development objectives and plan Leads the strategic planning the functional team in driving continual improvement and effectiveness of Quality Operations and Quality Systems. Establishes quality programs and initiatives to ensure products and assemblies are developed and manufactured in accord with applicable requirements. Leads and/or supports initiatives at Medtronic Singapore and across sites to ensure effective quality reporting, quality systems and quality improvement efforts and Customer-Focused Quality; supervise the Quality System Policy/Procedures Manual. Supports the implementation of engineering projects and provide management oversight in establishing the quality system requirement at other facilities and Medtronic projects. Coordinate testing and reporting of data backup restorations in accordance with Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). Communicate audit and review results to appropriate parties; ensure that issues are addressed and corrective actions are implemented. Job Requirements 2-5 years of direct experience in IT risk management, IT compliance, internal audit, and/or information security required Familiar with COBIT 5 CISA, CRISC Certification is preferred Proven ability to work cross-functionally and influence organization to accomplish goals Collaborative and team player; focused, passionate, with the ability to inspire confidence in employees and senior management Strong collaboration skills to work well with others from many different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experience Ability to work both independently with sole responsibility and as part of a team to deliver quality work product in a fast-paced environment Willingness and ability to adapt to new circumstances, information, and challenges Good project management skill Excellent communication skills, both verbal and in written

Executive Assistant (Centre for Healthcare Innovation) Job Description Be part of a team taking on the opportunities of tomorrow’s healthcare! The Centre for Healthcare Innovation (CHI) was formed to spearhead co-learning and innovation in healthcare, gearing up the workforce for the changes and evolution of healthcare demands. In establishing a future ready workforce, we are guided by three key thrusts: Building thought leadership in healthcare innovation and improvement; driving workforce transformation to focus on productivity and creating value for our patients; and enabling healthcare training to develop healthcare leaders of the future. Enabling our strategic thrusts are a closely-connected ecosystem of strategic innovation partners, as well as innovation programmes and funding that enable projects for healthcare redesign. Aligned with CHI’s key thrusts in driving innovation, the Grants and Innovation unit focuses on seeding innovation, building a healthy ecosystem and strengthening the culture of innovation. The Opportunities You will be responsible in: Providing Secretariat Support for CHI Partner Engagement Sessions and Division Meetings - Scheduling, agenda setting, slides collation, booking and setting up rooms / virtual spaces and minutes taking Supporting the planning and execution of CHI Learning Platforms i.e. Learning Visits, CHI Roundtable, Innovation Programmes - Managing RSVPs and publicity - Events and logistics management – venue booking, setting up of physical or virtual space, preparation of event materials and collaterals, etc - Assist with post-event activities such as archival of recorded events and sending out training evaluation forms. Participate and support the organization and administration of various CHI Projects Requirements Diploma in any discipline Good interpersonal, communication skills with the ability to work independently and in a team Keen attention to detail, ability to prioritize workload, be well organized and multi-task in a smart and timely fashion Prior administrative experience has an added advantage Proficiency in Microsoft Work, Excel, and Powerpoint, and social media tools Back Executive Assistant (Centre for Healthcare Innovation) Job Description Be part of a team taking on the opportunities of tomorrow’s healthcare! Manager (Research), Ophthalmology (Eye) Job Description The Challenges You will assist the Director, Administration & Operations, Head of Research and Clinician-in-charge for Quality Research to manage and plan all research and quality projects/ initiatives related to the NHG Eye Institute. You are the research and quality interface across all hospital services and functional units for the Institute. In addition, you will be responsible in planning, developing and managing resources within the Institute to meet the Institute’s/hospital’s objectives in research. The Requirements • Minimum Bachelor Degree in a related discipline • At least 8 years of relevant work experience, with at least 3 years of research/clinical quality experience in the healthcare or hospitality industries • Experience in managing projects and organising events • Confident, matured, energetic and resourceful with excellent communication, presentation and highly effective negotiation skills • Ability to write well and effectively is a must • Strong networking capabilities/experience will be an added advantage • Possess excellent leadership and interpersonal skills Back Manager (Research), Ophthalmology (Eye) Job Description The Challenges You will assist the Director, Administration & Operations, Head of Research and Clinician-in-charge for Quality Research to manage and plan all research and quality projects/ initiatives related to the NHG Eye Institute. Job_Title: Asst/Manager, Ops Surgery (Pre-Admission, Counseling and Evaluation)
Job_Descriptions: Asst/Manager, Ops Surgery (Pre-Admission, Counseling and Evaluation) Job Description The Challenges You will drive/ lead and implement strategic plans, provide operational oversight, undertake development projects, submit business proposals and assist in general administration including financial accountability/ budgeting, and performance management of key indicators.  You will also assist to continuously improve service quality level of, and perform coordinating roles for associated financial counseling and pre-admission tests for surgical procedures.  You will drive/lead process improvements and ensure delivery of an efficient operations and process flow for patient care journey.  You should possess good leadership qualities and management competency to drive and coordinate a broad spectrum of the assigned unit’s operations to be in line with TTSH strategic directions.  In addition, as the Reporting Officer of the assigned unit’s operational and administrative team, you are required to have oversight on general administration and HR matters pertaining to the unit. You should be an independent and self-driven individual with a passion for healthcare, and is keen to take up evolving opportunities provided to develop your career in healthcare management. Requirements • A good degree with at least 6 years of relevant working and supervisory experience.  The candidate with knowledge and experience on healthcare financial and ownership of an acute hospital’s clinical operational unit(s), and/or healthcare programmes and project management skill set is preferred. • A background in nursing or healthcare related disciplines will be an added advantage. • Possess good organizational and coordination skills as well as good interpersonal and communication skills. • Driven, passionate and service oriented. • Ability to exercise initiative, manage pressure, multi-task and work independently in a fast-paced environment. Job_Descriptions: Senior Staff Nurse / Staff Nurse (Operating Theatre) Job Description You need to demonstrate a high standard of patient care by performing clinical nursing procedures that meet the patients’ immediate physical and emotional needs. Requirements State Registered Nurse with at least 1 - 2 years of relevant experience preferably in multi-discipline set up High motivation, ability to work in a team and a fast paced environment Able to perform 3 rotating shifts Excellent interpersonal and communication skills We regret that only applications submitted through NHG Career Webpage (corp.nhg.com.sg/Careers), TTSH Career Webpage ([www.ttshhr.com]) and JobStreet Singapore (jobstreet.com.sg) will be considered. Job_Title: Snr / Exec (Clinical Education), People & Org Devt (1 Year Contract)
Job_Descriptions: Snr / Exec (Clinical Education), People & Org Devt (1 Year Contract) Job Description Broad Function The role of the Senior / Executive, Clinical Education, is to provide administration support in planning and implementing the set-up of the life support training and the operation and development of clinical education activities at Woodlands Health. The incumbent will work closely with key programme and administrative leads and stakeholders to ensure efficient programme planning and execution of the mentioned functions. Key Responsibilities and Duties Specific (60%) Provide administrative support in planning and preparing for life-support training centre accreditation including Preparation of audit requirements including curriculum, logistics, assessment checklists, with Programme Director and Chief Instructors Setting up of Training Site, Assessments (e-Learn) and reporting; Maintenance of manikin / equipment & resources to support training Coordinate with key stakeholders (e.g. L&D, Code Blue Committee Secretariat, Licensing task-force etc.) for management reporting in compliance with life support training policy and licensing requirements for key life support programs such as, but not limited to BCLS+AED, ACLS, LSCN etc Maintain the register of teaching /skills equipment, ensure appropriate use and maintenance is carried out.  Ensure simulation / life support centre and related resources are available and set-up adequately for training. Oversee scheduling of courses, registration and sign-up, in coordination with instructors and faculty Support the development of e-Learn and other mandatory clinical education/ training courses. Assist with implementation of courses and on-line access to computer based learning with key programme and education leads Administrative and secretariat support for training and education related matters including continuing education matters Pre-Professional Education & Clinical Education Areas (40%) Assist in planning and managing Pre-Professional Education including student rotations, faculty development, tracking of teaching appointments and other related activities Assist in governing the students’ adherence to the safety measures and guidelines Assist in up-keeping and maintaining training data and other essential documents in preparation of MOH reporting and annual audit Assisting supervisors in providing administrative and secretariat support for the operation and development of the clinical education and training at WH Job Requirements University Degree in any discipline from a recognised institution Preferably up to 3 years of related experience in healthcare &/or training capacity Proficient in MS Office, including Word, Excel and Powerpoint IT / Tech Savvy, with experience in handling on-line learning or LMS Data savvy and proficient with systems Able to multi-task and manage projects Technical experience in managing life support equipment an advantage Able to communicate effectively at all levels with good interpersonal skills Possess a good command of the English language, both written and spoken Please be informed that only applications submitted through NHG Career Webpage (corp.nhg.com.sg/Careers), WHC Career Webpage (whc.sg/joinus), JobStreet Singapore (jobstreet.com.sg), Singapore Medical Association (sma.org.sg), Singapore Nurses Association (sna.org.sg), MyCareersFuture.sg, LinkedIn and WHC appointed recruitment agencies will be considered. Job_Title: Mgr / Asst Mgr (Clinical Education), People & Organisation Development
Job_Descriptions: Mgr / Asst Mgr (Clinical Education), People & Organisation Development Job Description Broad Function The Assistant Manager / Manager for Clinical Education shall support Clinical Director (Education & Training) and Senior Director, People & Organisation Development in the development of clinical education in WH and implement key initiatives for the current and future WH workforce, healthcare partners, patients and care givers. Key Responsibilities and Duties Specific Supporting Clinical Director (Education & Training) and Senior Director, People & Organisation Development, the incumbent shall be responsible for: Clinical Workforce Development Development and implementation of clinical education and training in WH in support of the clinical competencies required of changing care models Overseeing Hospital Clinician (HC) Training in support of the WH HC Scheme Supporting other non-specialist workforce development programmes, e.g. RP training programmes Working hand-in-hand with Nursing and Pharmacy to support the APN and Pharmacy Residency programmes where necessary Junior Doctor Training (Residency, PGY1, MOs) Ensuring a conducive learning environment for clinical training where residents, PGY1s and MOs value their time with WH in their personal and professional development journey, building future pipeline for WH Ensuring that WH fulfills all the requirement for residency and PGY1 training, from funding to rotation curriculum, assessment, evaluation, faculty development, continuous programme improvement and any other requirements stipulated by MOH Continuous Clinical Professional Education Overseeing the planning and implementation of continuous clinical professional education in WH Developing and facilitating inter-professional clinical education and engagement Faculty Development and Recognition Ensuring a pipeline of clinical educators, faculty and education leaders for health professions education in WH Planning for and supporting health professions faculty development Managing and providing suitable recognition for the educators Developing/updating policies to support clinical education and training in WH as necessary Overseeing funding, budget and resourcing for clinical education in WH General Coordinate and support related projects under the department’s responsibility and undertake its related work working with internal and external stakeholders Work hand-in-hand with P&OD team to contribute to cross-cutting projects or organisation wide projects Perform any other duties as assigned by Clinical Director (Education & Training) and Senior Director, People & Organisation Development Job Requirements University Degree in any discipline from a recognised institution Preferably up at least 5 years of related experience in healthcare &/or education capacity Able to communicate effectively at all levels with good interpersonal skills Possess a good command of the English language, both written and spoken Possess good people skills IT / Tech Savvy, with experience in handling on-line learning or LMS Data savvy and proficient with systems Able to multi-task and manage projects Able to work in a fast paced start-up like environment Please be informed that only applications submitted through NHG Career Webpage (corp.nhg.com.sg/Careers), WHC Career Webpage (whc.sg/joinus), JobStreet Singapore (jobstreet.com.sg), Singapore Medical Association (sma.org.sg), Singapore Nurses Association (sna.org.sg), MyCareersFuture.sg, LinkedIn and WHC appointed recruitment agencies will be considered. If you are accessing this job posting from another recruitment channel, please visit the official channels mentioned above. Job_Title: Accounting/Finance - Accountant/Senior Accountant Financial Planning & Control
Job_Descriptions: Job Description The successful candidate will be part of Finance Division, Financial Planning & Control Department. He/She will be responsible for ensuring proper budgeting, correct accounting, timely processing, analysis and reporting of expenses/recoveries, as well as budgeting, forecasts and cost savings initiatives for Head Office Divisions (Fixed Cost) and Variable cost items under his/her responsibility. Key Responsibilities: • Operating expenditure accounting for Divisions under his/her charge: - Review and ensure that accruals/JVs put through for accuracy and completeness. Check for omissions/errors in invoices raised/JVs put through. - AR and AP invoice approvals. Review and ensure correct accounting allocation by Divisions. - Monitor and review monthly accounts variance analysis. Review and monitor Divisions’ expenditure against budget and forecast. Work with users on explanations for budget overruns, virement processes and supplementary budgets. Ensure that users comply with Finance Manual procedures on budgetary control. - Discuss and liaise with Divisions on accounting treatment for their business process/initiatives. - Compile and analyze material monthly expense variances. Submission of monthly, quarterly and yearly reports to Corporate Accounts & Projects department as per reporting timelines. - Monitor and clear suspense accounts to ensure that balances are within timelines set. Work with users on explanations for balances exceeding stipulated timelines. • Annual operating budget exercise: - Assist with preparation work for roll out of budget exercise. - Assist/Support Divisions on queries regarding budget and forecast. Job_Title: Senior/ Executive, Service Operations and Accreditation & Licensing
Job_Descriptions: SingHealth Community Hospitals Senior/ Executive, Service Operations and Accreditation & Licensing Job Description The Senior/ Executive reports to the Assistant/ Manager, Service Operations and Accreditation & Licensing (SO and A&L), on all operational, manpower and administrative matters of the section. Service Operations To support the three community hospitals (CHs) in aligning SingHealth Community Hospitals (SCH)’s strategic directions, he/ she will assist to implement and manage transformational improvement projects through operations analytics and improvements.  The Senior/ Executive will work with stakeholders across the three CHs to achieve agreed upon goals and objectives through excellent project management. He/ she is also expected to facilitate improvement projects, participate, coordinate and support the departments in clinical care pathways development and/or workflow discussions. For new processes, he / she would support tabletop exercises and full-dress rehearsals and document learnings for the teams. Compliance - Data Protection The Senior/ Executive will support the development, implementation and updating of the data protection policies and procedures in compliance with the Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA).  He / she will assist to update internal processes and procedures to comply with the obligations as stipulated in the PDPA and assist in rolling out the audits to identify gaps and enhance internal control systems of selected work procedure and processes.  The Senior/ Executive will organise and carry out activities to raise awareness of the personal data protection policies among the staff and attend to personal data protection related queries/ complaints and incidents.  He/ she will provide secretariat support for meetings related to data protection. Compliance - Accreditation & Licensing The Senior/ Executive is responsible for maintaining systems and processes to ensure conformance to MOH Licensing (PHMC), and other relevant standards including ISO Accreditation.  He / she is also involved in the planning, conduct, follow-up and closure of internal audit findings.  The Senior/ Executive will also support all departments on content management in various IT systems to meet the licensing requirements. Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) The Senior/ Executive will support the Assistant/ Manager to develop the SCH ERM work plan by collating and analysing risk information to highlight trends and areas of focus for senior management’s review annually.  He / she will work closely with stakeholders to monitor their key risks and co-ordinate all on-going ERM activities across the three CHs.  He / she will support the coordination and facilitation of ERM implementation at each CH and with key stakeholders (e.g. on-site GHs) to support the SCH ERM framework and programme.  He / she will also support the implementation and ensure SCH’s compliance to the SingHealth AEN framework for incidents reporting. Senior Country Risk Analyst - Asia Fitch Solutions provides data, research and analytics that help clients excel at managing their credit risk, offer deep insight into the debt investment market, and provide comprehensive intelligence about the macroeconomic environment. All available on our platform, Fitch Connect, designed and built using our credit, macro and industry expertise to help you make more informed decisions. Role: Senior Country Risk Analyst - Asia Location: Singapore This is an opportunity to join the Asia Country Risk team at the top-ranked independent research provider, Fitch Solutions. You will be contributing to our market intelligence service, providing analytical research for senior decision makers in banks, consultancies, multinational corporations, investment funds and government agencies. Role Work as part of the Asia Country Risk team, providing regular economic, political risk and financial market analysis. Act as analytical lead for a portfolio of major economies, taking full ownership of all forecasts and historical data. Write research notes on a daily basis, as well as contributing to monthly and quarterly analysis, producing both country-specific and thematic regional research including: economic growth, fiscal & monetary policy, trade, debt dynamics, political risk, financial markets and demographics. Work on maintaining and further developing proprietary data sets that add analytical value. Work with sales to represent the team and deliver key views and forecasts in a concise and articulate manner during client engagements as well as at industry events. Be a brand ambassador for our research and company. Be commercially minded and understand how research and data is used by our clients. Help mentor and guide more junior analysts on the team through training, editing and discussion of forecasts and views. Skills Relevant experience in economic analysis required, ideally with a focus on Asia, but we would consider a strong candidate who has been focused on a different region. Ability to manage own time and adhere to publication deadlines. Strong public speaker. Strong writing skills, with experience conveying complex views in a succinct and straightforward manner. Ability to work with and analyze large data sets and forecast across key macroeconomic indicators. Familiarity analysing connections between political and macroeconomic risk. Fluent spoken and written English, other languages beneficial. Strong team-working and communication skills, but also able to work independently. Qualifications BA/MA/MSc/PhD in economics or a closely related field. Relevant background working as a macroeconomic/sovereign risk analyst required, with experience in analysis, data management and forecasting. #LI-TD1 #LI-Solutions Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Wholly owned by the Hearst Corporation, we are comprised of three main businesses: Fitch Ratings | Fitch Solutions | Fitch Learning. For more information please visit our websites: www.fitchratings.com | www.fitchsolutions.com | www.fitchlearning.com Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch's credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will be asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts prior to commencing employment. If you, or your immediate family, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, you may be asked to divest yourself of them before beginning work. Fitch is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job_Title: Compliance Specialist - Client Review Team (Associate/ Senior Associate)
Job_Descriptions: Compliance Specialist - Client Review Team (Associate/ Senior Associate) At Bank of Singapore, we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. We promote a culture of openness, teamwork and fairness. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programmes that develop them on both professional and personal levels. Besides attractive remuneration packages, we offer non-financial benefits and opportunities to develop your potential within OCBC Group’s global network of subsidiaries and offices. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today! GENERAL DESCRIPTION This position within the Client Review Team of the Compliance Department is responsible for the periodic review of existing accounts of the Bank. The successful candidate is expected to be knowledgeable in AML principles to be able to analyse situations to identify AML issues and red flags in respect of existing client accounts, and to be able to work well within a team and yet take initiative and ownership over his/her own area of work. MAIN DUTIES Perform assessment on periodic reviews of existing relationships including but not limited to higher risk relationships and financial intermediaries. This includes reviewing the adequacy of SOW corroboration, performing high level transaction review, identifying incremental AML or reputational risk via refreshed name screening. Conduct investigations on suspicious transactions/ activities surfaced during periodic review and prepare STR reports to the STRO. Liaise with relationship managers/ business compliance managers for issues and deficiencies identified during periodic review. Escalate issues identified in the periodic review process and providing practical solutions to the businesses. Keep abreast of changes to regulatory requirements for AML/CFT and communicate changes internally with a view to ensuring established policies, procedures and processes are compliant with new requirements. Update and operationalize periodic review processes and workflows to ensure consistency amongst team members. Providing AML/CFT advice to businesses, in particular on matters pertaining to periodic review of clients. Assist with training for new joiners and front office personnel on periodic review regulatory requirements in Singapore. Liaise with auditors on AML/CFT queries related to Singapore. Prepare weekly Qualifications WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS Suitable candidates will have experience gained within private banking, regulatory or compliance environment, a sound understanding of financial markets and the ability to maintain and enhance productive relationships with staff and regulators. In addition, you will also have: For Associate position, minimum 3-4 years of AML experience (KYC review and transaction monitoring experiences) in a private banking environment in Singapore. For Senior Associate position, minimum 5-6 years of AML experience (KYC review and transaction monitoring experiences) in a private banking environment in Singapore. Experience and familiarity in transaction review work would be required. Willingness to take on a diverse product range and to leverage personal experience and skills into new areas. Knowledgeable and sensitive to the risks and suspicious activities typical of private banking clients. Familiar with excel and preparation of statistics for reporting. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Commercial astuteness. Self-motivated personality with the ability to make things happen. Ability to work independently, determine priorities and meet deadlines. Meticulous and conscientious. EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS University degree in Accountancy, Finance, Business Administration or equivalent, or higher education. Professional certifications such as ACAMs or ICA would be an added advantage.

Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. Our office is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre, which has been carefully crafted into a "city in a garden". Overlooking the scenic skyline along the Marina Bay waterfront, the green spaces and rooftop terraces have been designed to optimise employee well-being. The centre provides an integrated live-work-play development, surrounded by shops, restaurants, gyms and an alfresco dining area. Our convenient office location means you're just a 5-minute walk from the nearest MRT station.
